sourceMeaningMnemonic: I'm putting all my <radical>shellfish</radical> on <radical>someone</radical>, hoping they'll win the race! This is a <kanji>gamble</kanji> and you're gambling.
meaningInfo: Remember, shellfish used to be used as money. So if you're betting shellfish on someone, you're just gambling. And you probably won't get any of those shellfish back.
readingMnemonic: If you win this <kanji>gamble</kanji> you'll have enough shellfish to buy a brand new <reading>ca</reading>r (<ja>か</ja>)!
readingInfo: If you go to any of those fancy (and not so fancy) gamble-places, they always have a car sitting in the middle of the room. Usually rotating, really slowly, to make you want it more, making you gamble more.
